arch:property.oc:show_val: This locus is opened because when we were digging L4 (the north-east part of the trench) we found a skeleton pieces so we gave this locus to this area. To see the skeleton clearly the north baulk of the trench was widened 0.5m through the north and it was widened 2.1m through the west from the east baulk. I forget to give a new locus number to the burial so L7 contains the burial and aroun it. Skeleton appeared to be lying in a flexed position on its right side, with the head facing east. Burial definitely detached at waist and no other bones were in sight. Today is the last day of the excavation so this locus is closed.

arch:note.arch:string: Contexts excavated in trenches were recorded using the "locus system." A locus is any discrete three-dimensional entity excavated in a trench. The key to the locus system is the recognition that a locus is any one thing. Differences in soil composition or texture are therefore as important as, for example, the difference between a pit and a wall. If two entities were distinct, they were considered separate loci and were therefore assigned separate locus numbers. It should also be noted that every context excavated in a trench was given a locus number and thus the trench itself is made up completely of excavated loci.

oc:metadata.dc:title: Kenan Tepe: Area F / Trench 14 / Locus 7 (Locus)
